What is the purpose of the 'strict' directive in JavaScript?
OptionB: It enforces a stricter parsing and error handling on the code.
OptionC: It allows restricted access to certain functions.
OptionD: It is used only for compatibility with older browsers.
CorrectAnswer: It enforces a stricter parsing and error handling on the code.
